title: Button
description: A button communicates the action that it is going to initiate. Users can tap a button to begin a process or workflow, or to trigger an action.

Enabled.description: Sets the button as enabled or disabled.

IsVisible.description: Sets the visibility of the control.

OnPress.description: Action/Rule to be triggered when the button is pressed.

TextAlignment.description: [Deprecated. Use `Alignment` instead.] Choose one of the options based on how you want the text alignment on your button to appear.

Alignment.description: Choose one of the options based on how you want the content alignment on your button to appear.

enum.description: Less emphasis but still require users's attention.
Less important actions users can take.

ButtonType.description: The important types of the button.

enum.description: Use it for neutral actions, e.g. Back / Cancel.
Use it for positive actions, e.g. Update / Add / Approve.
Use it for negative actions, e.g. Delete / Reset / Reject.

Semantic.description: Use the semantic buttons for positive and negative actions.

Image.description: The image to be displayed along with the title.

ImagePosition.description: Position of the image to be displayed along with the title

ImageSize.description: Size of the image to be displayed along with the title

Separator.description: Sets the visibility of the separator line below the control. This property will take precedence over `ControlSeparator` in section and is only supported for Form Cell control in Sectioned Table and not supported in Form Cell Container.

Background.description: [Deprecated. Use `Button` instead.] The string value is a style class name of `Background`.

Value.description: [Deprecated. Use `Button` instead.] The string value is a style class name of `Value`.

Image.description: The string value is a style class name of `Image`. The CSS property `background-color` is supported for all image types (iOS only), while `font-size` and `color` are additionally supported for SAP icon and font icon types.

Button.description: The string value is a style class name of `Button`.
